intro: Helodeaster maviensis, commonly known as the Maviensis helodeaster, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
